conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, and C) and follow its trajectory through the baffles.
Source A is located at the top left corner.
Liquid from Source A flows downward and encounters the first baffle, which is angled to the right.
Liquid from Source A follows the angle of the first baffle and moves to the right.
Liquid from Source A encounters the second baffle, which is also angled to the right.
Liquid from Source A continues to move rightward.
Liquid from Source A reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
Source B is located at the middle top.
Liquid from Source B flows downward and encounters the first baffle, which is angled to the left.
Liquid from Source B follows the angle of the first baffle and moves to the left.
Liquid from Source B encounters the second baffle, which is angled to the right.
Liquid from Source B moves rightward.
Liquid from Source B reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
Source C is located at the top right corner.
Liquid from Source C flows downward and encounters the first baffle, which is angled to the left.
Liquid from Source C follows the angle of the first baffle and moves to the left.
Liquid from Source C encounters the second baffle, which is angled to the right.
Liquid from Source C continues to move rightward.
Liquid from Source C reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Final Answer: Liquid from source A flows into container D. Liquid from source B flows into container D. Liquid from source C flows into container E.
